text.tspan: Beneath the melting polar ice, deadly germs that had been
dormant for millennia spread across the globe. Diseases of
all kinds rapidly overwhelmed humanity, and a series of
natural disasters began to destroy the planet.
Dwindling resources and petty disputes between nations
stood in the way of their united stand against the
catastrophe, so their last opportunity passed in vain.
In the year 2050 AD, humanity has reached a singularity.
After a prolonged period of consumption, human
civilization has rapidly exhausted the planet's resources,
and the place they call home is devastated.
In 2051, the first missile was fired, signaling the beginning of World War III. No one knows what triggered it. It could have been a localized war
between hated enemies, terrorism by a fanatical religious organization, or simply a blind missile launched due to a technical error, but the truth
didn't matter to anyone. It was a savage, brutal war with no laws, no rules, or morals. Humanity utilized its deadliest weapons on each other as
if it were trying to use up all the weapons it had ever accumulated.
Humanity's greatest challenge upon returning to the surface was survival. To find uncontaminated land, build
facilities to purify water, and find areas where they could be self-sufficient. In a world of ash and dust, they had to
face death daily to survive. There was no meaning to nations or people before the war. In a world where so much
of humanity was gone, humans cooperated and formed tribes to survive. With great sacrifice, they found the few
remaining viable areas on the ground and put down roots. Humanity, once destroyed by war, was rebuilding its
society once again, and it was around this time that the name Jake Marcus came to the forefront of history.
